## Objetivo
In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 57464`.
## Solución
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/picoCTF/miniRSA]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 57464
c: 
n: 
e: 
        
```

Cambiamos lo valores que dicen que estan cambiado

```python
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/picoCTF/miniRSA]
└─$ python3                                
Python 3.12.6 (main, Sep  7 2024, 14:20:15) [GCC 14.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> e = 65537
>>> m = pow(c,e,n)
>>> m
180638594769037903267909311328535969949661653320322151351464061
>>> print(hex(m))
0x7069636f4354467b6261645f31643361355f323135323732307d

```


![[Pasted image 20241021202053.png]]


## Solucion 2
Instalamos RsaCtfTool desde si repositorio y descargamos sus librerias
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~/picoCTF/miniRSA/RsaCtfTool]
└─$ python3 RsaCtfTool.py -n  -e  --decrypt         
private argument is not set, the private key will not be displayed, even if recovered.
```

## Notas Adicionales
e se intercambio por d
